intro: Bouvardia glabra var. obtusa, commonly known as the smooth bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, and it prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. Bouvardia glabra var. obtusa is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
